description: Returns information about the configured alarms. Specify an alarm name in your request to return information about a specific alarm, or specify a monitored resource name to return information about all alarms for a specific resource. An alarm is used to monitor a single metric for one of your resources. When a metric condition is met, the alarm can notify you by email, SMS text message, and a banner displayed on the Amazon Lightsail console. For more information, see Alarms in Amazon Lightsail.

parameters.name: alarmName
parameters.description: The name of the alarm. Specify an alarm name to return information about a specific alarm.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request. To get a page token, perform an initial GetAlarms request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

parameters.name: monitoredResourceName
parameters.description: The name of the Lightsail resource being monitored by the alarm. Specify a monitored resource name to return information about all alarms for a specific resource.

nested_items.name: alarms
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the alarms.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the alarm.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the alarm was created.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type of the alarm.

nested_items.name: supportCode
nested_items.description: The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

nested_items.name: monitoredResourceInfo
nested_items.description: An object that lists information about the resource monitored by the alarm.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource being monitored.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the Lightsail resource being monitored.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type of the resource being monitored.

nested_items.name: comparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic and threshold.

nested_items.name: evaluationPeriods
nested_items.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

nested_items.name: period
nested_items.description: The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

nested_items.name: threshold
nested_items.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

nested_items.name: datapointsToAlarm
nested_items.description: The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold to trigger the alarm.

nested_items.name: treatMissingData
nested_items.description: Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
breaching - Assume the missing data is not within the threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric is not within the threshold.
notBreaching - Assume the missing data is within the threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the metric is not within the threshold.
ignore - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current alarm state.
missing - Missing data is treated as missing.

nested_items.name: statistic
nested_items.description: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.
Minimum - The lowest value observed during the specified period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your application.
Maximum - The highest value observed during the specified period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your application.
Sum - All values submitted for the matching metric added together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of a metric.

Average - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your resources.
SampleCount - The count, or number, of data points used for the statistical calculation.

nested_items.name: metricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The current state of the alarm.
ALARM - The metric is outside of the defined threshold.
INSUFFICIENT_DATA - The alarm has just started, the metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the metric to determine the alarm state.
OK - The metric is within the defined threshold.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

nested_items.name: contactProtocols
nested_items.description: The contact protocols for the alarm, such as Email, SMS (text messaging), or both.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: notificationTriggers
nested_items.description: The alarm states that trigger a notification.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: notificationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the alarm is enabled.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
